overview_summary: The neighboring entities comprise family-owned agricultural LLCs and the county government. Both S&S Hammond LLC and Hammond Family LLC are Saline County farmland owners with multi-generational ties, focusing on agriculture and land value. Saline County itself, as the local government, holds regulatory power and will prioritize community and development guidelines. None appear to be established renewable energy developers, but their positions could shape project outcomes – the Hammonds likely weigh farmland impacts and potential benefits, while the county will balance economic growth with public interest.

neighbors.name: S&S Hammond LLC
neighbors.claims: S&S Hammond LLC is a Kansas-registered limited liability company identified as the owner of multiple agricultural parcels in Saline County [Saline County Appraiser](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/Appraiser/parcelsearch). The company appears to be a private family land-holding entity with no public-facing operations beyond owning and managing farmland ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/real-estate#:~:text=Real%20Estate%20,Real%20Estate%20services%20includes%20recording)). No records of S&S Hammond LLC’s direct involvement in other businesses or political activities are evident in public filings, suggesting its sole purpose is to hold family farm property ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/register-of-deeds#:~:text=Image%20Why%20did%20my%20free,If%20you%20have)) ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/real-estate#:~:text=Real%20Estate%20,Real%20Estate%20services%20includes%20recording)). Likewise, no public statements or documented stance on development projects could be found for S&S Hammond LLC, indicating that any position would likely be voiced informally by the Hammond family members rather than through the LLC itself (unknown stance) ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/register-of-deeds#:~:text=Image%20Why%20did%20my%20free,If%20you%20have)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-time local farm owners but limited broader economic or political influence; known primarily within agricultural circles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Hammond family principals personally (e.g., at their farm); emphasize respect for their farming needs and offer assurances (or incentives) that the project will co-exist with agriculture. Highlight any benefits like improved infrastructure or lease opportunities to address their financial and land-use concerns.

neighbors.name: Hammond Family LLC
neighbors.claims: Hammond Family LLC is another family-held Kansas LLC owning farmland in Saline County, registered under the Hammond family name [Saline County Treasurer](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/tax-levy-sheets-and-tax-rolls). It functions as a vehicle for consolidating family agricultural assets, and public records list it as the titleholder of rural property in the project area ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/real-estate#:~:text=Real%20Estate%20,Real%20Estate%20services%20includes%20recording)) ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/register-of-deeds#:~:text=Image%20Why%20did%20my%20free,If%20you%20have)). The LLC itself conducts no observable business beyond land ownership, and no distinct public profile or corporate activities are associated with it ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/register-of-deeds#:~:text=Image%20Why%20did%20my%20free,If%20you%20have)). There are no public reports of Hammond Family LLC taking a position on local developments; any views on the project would likely reflect the personal views of the Hammond family stakeholders rather than a formal corporate stance (none documented) ([www.salinecountyks.gov](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/register-of-deeds#:~:text=Image%20Why%20did%20my%20free,If%20you%20have)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local farming family with modest land holdings; respected locally but without significant political or economic leverage

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate directly with the Hammond family members behind the LLC (likely elders or decision-makers); show how the project can be compatible with farming and possibly benefit their family (e.g., through fair compensation or improved road access). Address any concerns about environmental or operational impacts on their land early to build goodwill.

neighbors.name: Saline County
neighbors.claims: Saline County is the local government jurisdiction encompassing the project area, and it holds authority over land use and infrastructure in unincorporated parts of the county ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=After%20years%20of%20discussions%20on,sits%20on%20unincorporated%20county%20property)). The county itself owns certain parcels (such as road rights-of-way or public lands) near the project site, reflecting its role in providing local services and infrastructure ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=After%20years%20of%20discussions%20on,sits%20on%20unincorporated%20county%20property)). The Saline County Board of Commissioners is responsible for zoning approvals and permitting for developments; for example, in 2023 the commission voted to grant consent for a major housing project on county land, demonstrating its key role in approving or facilitating developments ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=After%20years%20of%20discussions%20on,sits%20on%20unincorporated%20county%20property)) ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=County%20Commissioners%20saw%20the%20issue,28%20meeting%20and%20voted)). While the county government doesn’t take a “for” or “against” stance like a private party, it will evaluate the project based on regulatory compliance, public interest, and alignment with county plans (“stance” to be determined through formal review) ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=Saline%20County%20Commission%20Chairman%20Robert,property%20surrounded%20by%20city%20jurisdiction)) ([salinapost.com](https://salinapost.com/posts/7de72111-cbd7-449b-b7f3-af60fc7670cb#:~:text=of%20Magnolia%20Road%2C%20the%20Saline,sits%20on%20unincorporated%20county%20property)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local governing authority with permitting power; controls roads, zoning, and can approve or block projects

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage county officials through formal channels – attend commission meetings, provide transparent project details, and emphasize community benefits (jobs, tax base). Align the project with Saline County’s development goals and address any regulatory requirements or public concerns proactively to secure county support. (Note: Treat Saline County as a regulatory stakeholder rather than an opponent or proponent.)
